dublinCore.dc:title: 113 HR 5043 IH: Partnering to Abolish Child Trafficking Act
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Peters of California introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Foreign Affairs

form.official-title: To amend the Trafficking Victims Protection Act of 2000 to direct the Secretary of State to submit reports to Congress on child protection compacts.

section.text: This Act may be cited as—

paragraph.text: the Partnering to Abolish Child Trafficking Act; or

section.text: Section 105A(d) of the Trafficking Victims Protection Act of 2000 (22 U.S.C. 7103a(d)) is amended by adding at the end the following:

paragraph.text: The Secretary of State, acting through the Director established pursuant to section 105(e)(1) of this Act, shall submit an annual report to Congress, which shall include information regarding—

subparagraph.text: child protection compacts under this subsection;
countries with which the United States may enter into a child protection compact under this subsection; and
